actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection

official_title: To prohibit the manufacture, marketing, sale, or shipment in interstate commerce of products designed to assist in defrauding a drug test.

summary.text: Drug Testing Integrity Act of 2005 - Declares it is unlawful to: (1) knowingly manufacture, market, sell, ship, or otherwise provide to another individual any product with the intent to assist the use of such product to defraud a drug test (that is, to submit a substance that purports to be from an individual other than its actual source, or purports to have been excreted or collected other than when it was actually excreted or collected); or (2) engage in any other conduct with the intent to produce a false or misleading outcome of a test for the presence of a controlled substance. Grants the Federal Trade Commission enforcement powers as a violation of an unfair or deceptive act or practice.

titles.title: To prohibit the manufacture, marketing, sale, or shipment in interstate commerce of products designed to assist in defrauding a drug test.
